discourse_list.title: Mistakenly Sent my DAI to a contact address

content.content: Hello, i made a mistake and sent 15k DAI to MTRG smart contract(0xBd2949F67DcdC549c6Ebe98696449Fa79D988A9F) from my address(0x3895f38d1ab88d2214bffa9eb352210e33a69b53). Is there a solution that can be done, its my life savings. Can the devs do something https://etherscan.io/tx/0x2627d02a4e621d71f13efcf704b65603f45fca7d54b69c583f7c658b8f1b3653

DAI is not a currency that can be frozen or reversed. To do this you will need to contact the people at the SmartContract you sent it to, although most of the time the response is the same. When you send something to a contract directly without it being an interaction it is usually lost. However, the protocol works to provide solutions for those who, like you, have lost funds in the wrong way.

Hey @Jaypomping, your best bet is to contact the development team of MTRG and hope that they are able to retrieve your funds from that particular smart contract. Unfortunately there is nothing the MakerDAO team can do to help you retrieve your funds. All the best

discourse_list.title: Dai sent to the wrong address

content.content: hello, i have a problem. I sent  dai from the fantom network to a binance address that does not support  dai. can I somehow get my funds back?
Hey, @pom11. Welcome to the forums. Unfortunately, there’s not a lot that Maker can do. Others have been suggested to contact either fantom or finance to try their luck.
If you sent it to a Binance Exchange wallet you should contact their support, they usually help in cases like this.

discourse_list.title: Sent my dai to wrong address

content.content: I accidentally sent my dai to a makerdao some time ago. I went to send it from the bsc network to ethereum but it still ended up in the bsc network which i guess is a plus. This is the transaction. Hoping for some good news on this haha sucks. Binance Transaction Hash (Txhash) Details | BscScan
Reason the wallet isnt very active is because it is compromised. If i am able to get my funds back they’d have to go to a different wallet.
